Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2014 02:21PM Shelfish wrote: My story is similar: I am 45 and had my annual mamo (3 months late).  The hospital called and had me come back that day for another mamo.  They found suspicious microcalcifications which were labeled BIRAD 4.  That lead me to a second opinion that lead me to a stereotactic biopsy which came back as ALH.  I had a surgical excursion last Thursday 10/30/14 (removed about the size of a large grape) and am waiting on the results from that.  All along the doctors and radiologist have told me they thought it was not cancer.  I've really not been too concerned. With the ALH diagnosis, I was told that I am at a higher risk of developing breast cancer and should be screened every 6 months.
Posts.Title: Microcalcifications with no mass - very first Mammogram age 40 hnrutten Itzia

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2014 05:00AM Shelfish wrote: Got my results from my surgical biopsy Friday 11/7... Benign!!  Thinking about you tracyn.  Looks like you were supposed to have your surgical biopsy on 11/7.  Please let me know how it goes.
